data.DEN: Address. Country. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The country code of this address (ISO 3166-1).

data.DEN: Billing_ Address. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Billing address information.

data.DEN: Billing_ Address. Defined. Address
Physical_ Address. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Physical address information.

data.DEN: Physical_ Address. Defined. Address
Message_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Message

data.DEN: Message_ List. Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Coded identification of the table.

data.DEN: Message_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the table.

data.DEN: Message_ List. Table Creation Date Time. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The date and time the table was created.

data.DEN: Message_ List. Number of Records in Table. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Number of records in this table. When a table is split over more then one file this is the total of records within the several table files.

data.DEN: Message_ List. XML Attributes. Code
Message_ List. Creation Date Time. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Date and time the file was created.

data.DEN: Primary_ Contact. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Primary contact information.

data.DEN: Primary_ Contact. . Contact
Tax_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Tax information.

data.DEN: Tax_ List. Tax Type Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of Tax type. Shall match the Tax_Type_Code in the BAS_Tax_Type table.

data.DEN: Tax_ List. Local Amount. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in local currency.

data.DEN: Tax_ List. Transaction Amount. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.

data.DEN: Tax_ List. Defined. Debit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which the debit side of the Tax transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: Tax_ List. Defined. Credit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which the credit side of the Tax transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ Code. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Account segment information.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Employee
data.DESCRIPTION: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers). The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Project
data.DESCRIPTION: This field is a fixed account segement, recording information related to a project; for example, construction projects which require a separate accounting. The value of this field stored is Project_ID. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table through GL_Account_Segment.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Bank Account
data.DESCRIPTION: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts. The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number, and we can get more information of a certain bank account in the BAS_Bank_Account table. Shall match the Bank_Account_Number in the BAS_Bank_Account table through GL_Account_Segment.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. X_ Account Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: Reserved field that shall be used for supplementary information associated with particular account. The 'X' signifies that each unique account segment will be captured in a separate field.

data.DEN: Accounting Period_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains information related to accounting period including the corresponding fiscal year, the beginning and ending date. The table captures the time range within a specific reporting period and year, in which business transactions and entries are accumulated into financial statements and other reports.

data.DEN: Accounting Period_ List. ID
Accounting Period_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1.

data.DEN: Accounting Period_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The accounting period in which the calendar date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date.

data.DEN: Accounting Period_ List. Beginning. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.

data.DEN: Accounting Period_ List. Ending. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The calendar ending date of the current accounting period.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the details of a bank account.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center. ISO 13616 is recommended if applicable.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Account Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the financial institution ((ISO 9362 or ISO 17442). ISO 17442 is preferred. One reason is that bank branch identifier will not change due to location movement.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The full name of the institution for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Branch Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the institutiones branch.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Branch Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The full name of the institution's branch.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Branch Country. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The country code where the bank is physically located (ISO 3166-1).

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Branch Region. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Sub-region within country; in the U.S., this would be a state; in Canada it would be a province.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the bank account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Bank Account_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: Bill Type_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains information of bill type, for example, bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check. Bills are frequently used in the business cycle of sales and purchase, as evidence of debt, payment and/or settlement instrument.

data.DEN: Bill Type_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the bill type; for example, using 004 to represent bank draft, 005 to represent promissory note, 006 to represent check.

data.DEN: Bill Type_ List. Bill Type Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the bill type; for example, bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check.

data.DEN: Bill Type_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the bill type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Business Segment_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: "The BAS_Business_Segment and the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy have been designed to tabularize the portions of an organizational chart that is reflected in the business transactions as structural units  e.g. business unit, department, cost center and project).

data.ENTITY: The fields within the BAS_Business_Segment are used to capture the individual organizational unit represented by each box on an organizational diagram."

data.DEN: Business Segment_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of each business segment.

data.DEN: Business Segment_ List. Business Segment Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the business segment.

data.DEN: Business Segment_ List. Segment Reference Level. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The relative level of the segment with 1 being the consolidated level and numbers increasing through lower levels of the organizational chart.

data.DEN: Business Segment_ List. Organization Type Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Indicate the name of the organization type, for example 'Department' and 'Cost Center'.

data.DEN: Business Segment Hierarchy_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: The fields in the BAS_Business_Segment_Hierarchy are used to capture the relationships between the individual organization units. The table assumes a one to one relationship and captures the data necessary to consolidate transactions occurring for child level organizational units into higher level organizational structures (for example, business unit to division).

data.DEN: Business Segment Hierarchy_ List. Parent. Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the parent business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment _Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DEN: Business Segment Hierarchy_ List. Child. Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the child business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the information about GL accounts, including name, description, type and hierarchy. This table is level 1. When it is cross-referred by other table(s), consistency shall apply. For example, in this table, the value of GL_Account_Number is 101, the value of GL_Account_Name is cash, and the value of Balance_Debit_Or_Credit is D, if the value of GL_Account_Number in GL_Tial_Balance table is 101, then the Amount corresponding with cash account (101) must be debit.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. GL Account Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name for the GL account.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. GL Account Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. FS Caption. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The financial statement caption represents a related group of accounts; for example, cash and cash equivalents, accounts payable and cost of sales. The caption can be at the trial balance level.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Type. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The type of account; for example, assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Subtype. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The subtype of the account; for example, current assets are the subtype of assets.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Hierarchy. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy; for example, using 1 to represent assets, and 2 to represent the account subtype current assets.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Balance_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This field is used to indicate whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating 'D' or 'C', where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Parent. Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the parent account in an account hierarchy. This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the chart of accounts table.When Parent_GL_Account_Number is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value, for example set to NULL. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: Currency_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the information of the currency.

data.DEN: Currency_ List. Currency. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the currency type (ISO 4217, Codes for the representation of currencies).

data.DEN: Currency_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the currency type in the accounting and/or ERP system.

data.DEN: Currency_ List. Minor Unit. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: "The unit of recorded value which is a division of the respective unit of currency. Minor unit shows the decimal relationship between such unit and the currency itself (ISO 4217). Number 0 means that there is no minor unit for that currency, whereas number 1, 2, 3, etc. signify a ratio of 10:1, 100:1, 1000:1, etc. respectively.

data.ENTITY: EXAMPLE The US cent is a one hundredth part of the US dollar; the GB penny is a one hundredth part of the pound sterling. The minor unit number for both is 2."

data.DEN: Currency_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether Currency_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: An account segment is a customized file item, which includes the information of the customized account segments that are not fixed account segments and no other table contains their description information, for example region type. This table is used together with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Value.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of customized account segment which audit data needs to be used; this does not include the fixed account segment having been identified; for example, unlike customer, budget information is not included in the base module as an individual table, therefore budget can be identified as a customized segment.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The customized account segment name which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget records planned revenue and expenditure.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The customized account segment description which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget can be described as the annual plan of aggregated fiscal revenue and expenditure for a state, which is verified and approved through legal procedures.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Encoding Rule. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment. If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by '-'; for example, budget (with 1-digit code, like 1) can be subdivided into financial budget (with 2-digit code, like 01) and construction budget (with 2-digit code, like 05), with the financial budget containing budgeted revenue (with 2-digit code, like 03) and budgeted expenditure (with 2-digit code, like 04), which are the third level segments. In this case, Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Hierarchy Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Whether the table value has a hierarchy feature or not. '1' means 'yes', '0' means 'no'.

data.DEN: Customized Account Segment_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the information from the customized account segment value.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the customized account segment value. If the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2, the corresponding budget-financial budget-budgeted expenditure is 10104.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Segment Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This field is associated with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the AS_Customized_ACC_Segment table.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the account segment value of each file. EXAMPLE budget, financial budget, budgeted expenditure.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The detailed description of the account segment value.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Parent. Customized Account Value
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the parent customized account segment value. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Value_Code in BAS_Customized_ACC_Value table.

data.DEN: Customized Account Value_ List. Customized Account Value Hierarchy. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The level of the current value in the file structure. For example, '1' means 'the highest'.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the personnel information of the employee in an independent accounting unit.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone does part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID in this table. And the part time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the employee.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Inactive Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Indicate whether one employee is active or inactive. One employee may become inactive due to some reasons such as sabbatical.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Type Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the employee types. For example, using 004 to represent an on-the job employee, 005 to represent a retired employee, 006 to represent a deceased employee, 007 to represent a part time employee.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Type Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the employee type. For example, employed, retired, probation and part-time.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Department Code. Department Code_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of department rosters. For example, the IT department is designated as code 0018. The code shall match the Business_Segment_code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Job Title. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The job title of the person in an accounting unit. For example, accounting manager.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Academic Degree. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The highest academic degree acquired; for example Doctor, Master.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Employment Date. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The employment date of the employee.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Termination Date. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.

data.DEN: Employee_ Person. Defined. System User_ Person
data.DESCRIPTION: The system user ID associated with the employee. The ID shall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.

data.DEN: Journal Entry Type_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains information relevant with the GL journal entry type, for example, cash receipts, cash disbursements.

data.DEN: Journal Entry Type_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the journal entry type; for example, using 004 to represent a cash receipt entry, 005 to represent a cash disbursement entry, 006 to represent a non-cash entry.

data.DEN: Journal Entry Type_ List. Type Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the journal entry type. This is usually categorized by business to satisfy an internal control need and/or to facilitate sorting and querying; for example, journal entries could be classified based on whether the transaction involves cash. In this case there may be cash receipt entry, cash disbursement entry, and non-cash entry of adjusting that is the recording of interest revenue earned and wages payable, estimation that is the recording depreciation, and bad-debt expenses, and/or correction that makes entries to counteract the effects of errors found in the general ledger.

data.DEN: Journal Entry Type_ List. Abbreviation. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The abbreviation of the journal entry type.

data.DEN: Journal Entry Type_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the JE type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Measurement Unit_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains information of the measurement unit (UOM) used in the modules of general ledger, sales, purchase and inventory and PPE.

data.DEN: Measurement Unit_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the measurement unit.

data.DEN: Measurement Unit_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the material.

data.DEN: Measurement Unit_ List. Abbreviation. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The abbreviation of the measurement unit's name; for example, kilogram is recorded as 'kg' and square meter is recorded as 'sq.m'.

data.DEN: Measurement Unit_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the UOM_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the details of the payment term, which is applied and referenced in the purchase ans sales modules.The payment term refers to the condition of a sale/purchase agreement and is related to how the customer will pay (type of credit instrument), and especially how much time is allowed for payment (credit period) and discount (cash discount and discount period).

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the payment term; for example, terms of 2/10, net 60 could be quoted. This means that customers have 60 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. However, if payment is made within 10 days, a 2 percent cash discount can be taken.

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The full name of the payment term.

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. Line Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the lines according to the Payment_Term_Code value. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The detailed description of the payment termes line; for example, payment due date, discount days, discount percentage.

data.DEN: Payment Term_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the payment term is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains industry and software version information. This table contains information related to the profile of the data being collected. For instance, when we extract the financial data of 2016 from an auditee using SAP XXX ERP System in 2017.1.16, we should have a record with the Profile_Name
, Fiscal_Year
, Developer_Name
SAP
, Software_Name
SAP_S/4
, Software_Version
, Functional_Currency
CNY, Standard_Version
, Extracted_Date

data.DEN: Profile_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the current data collection. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the current data collection.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The date shall be shown as 'YYYY-MM-DD' in the extended format and the YYYY indicates a fourdigit year (ISO 8601-1).

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Accounting Entity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The legal name of accounting entity.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Industry. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The corresponding industry name under superior sector code.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Developer Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software developer.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Software Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software products.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Software Version. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The accounting and/or ERP system software version.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Functional_ Currency Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The functional or group currency used in accounting and/or ERP system software (ISO 4217).

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Standard Version. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The standard issuing No. of the standards with which the current output files are consistent; for example, ISO 21378.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Extracted. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The date of data extraction.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Time Zone. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The Time_Zone indicates the difference between local time and UTC of day. The representation of the difference can be expressed in hours and minutes, or hours only. The Time_Zone shall be shown as '}hh:mm in the extended format (ISO 8601-1). EXAMPLE Newfoundlandfs time zone =-03:30, Beijingfs time zone=+08:00.

data.DEN: Profile_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the detailed information related to the project; for example, construction project, government or business-funded research project. Projects are commonly administrated seperately and could be subject to being audit in accordance with regulatory and/or managerial requirements. The audit of a project is a thorough examination of the management, execution, methodology, procedures, records, budgets, expenditures, and the degree of completion. It is referenced in several modules including the GL, AR, AP and Inventory.

data.DEN: Project_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of each project.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the project related to operation and administration.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Beginning Date. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The beginning date of the project.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Ending Date. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The ending date of the project.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the project is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Project_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: Settlement Method_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains information on methods used to settle transactions. Businesses can adopt various methods to settle transactions and transfer money, especially in sales and purchase activities. Typical settlement methods include: cash settlements, issuing bills, using credit cards, bank remittances and bank collection.

data.DEN: Settlement Method_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money; for example, 001 for cash, 002 for bills, 003 for credit card, 004 for remittance, and 005 for bank collection.

data.DEN: Settlement Method_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the settlement method; for example, cash settlement, issuing bills, credit card, bank remittance and bank collection.

data.DEN: Settlement Method_ List. Active Flag. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: This indicates whether the settlement method is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains essential and generic information of the customers.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the customer. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Parent. Customer
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the parent customer. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Account. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the customer. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the customer.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Abbreviation. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The abbreviation of the customer's name.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Corresponding. Supplier
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the corresponding supplier in case that the customer is also a supplier. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table. Otherwise set NULL.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Type ID. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the BAS_Customer_Type table.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. TIN. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The customeres tax identification number. This number is usually generated by tax regulator.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Inactive. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The date that the customer was declared inactive. For example a customer may become inactive due to exceeding credit limit, legal restrictions, contract termination or bankruptcy etc.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Transaction_ Credit Limit. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The per invoice credit limit established for this customer.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Defined. Physical_ Address
Customer_ Party. Defined. Billing_ Address
Customer_ Party. Defined. Primary_ Contact
Customer_ Party. was. Created_ Handling
Customer_ Party. was. Approved_ Handling
Customer_ Party. was. Last Modified_ Handling
Customer_ Party. Total_ Credit Limit. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The credit limit for this customerfs total outstanding balance.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Terms Discount. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The discount percentage the customer can take if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Terms Discount Days. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of days from the invoice date the customer has to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as integers with no decimal places; for example, 10 days would be represented as 10.

data.DEN: Customer_ Party. Terms Due Days. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The default number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.

data.DEN: Customer Type_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains detailed descriptions of the customer type.

data.DEN: Customer Type_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: Customer Type_ List. Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the customer type; for example, using 004 to represent a Platinum customer, 005 to represent a Gold customer and 006 to represent a Silver customer. BAS_Customer_Type_Code and BAS_Customer_Type_Name are not necessarily related.

data.DEN: Customer Type_ List. Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the type categorized by the customer attributes; for example, platinum customer, gold customer and silver customer.

data.DEN: Customer Type_ List. Parent. Customer Type
data.DESCRIPTION: "The unique identifier for the parent customer type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Type_ID in the

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the cumulative total and balance of accounts in each accounting period, facilitating the calculation of beginning, ending balance, duration amounts and quantity, thus reflecting information and changes in GL more intuitively. In this table, the quantity can serve different regulatory and managerial purposes. For example, subledgers of inventory and PPE may not be covered in some auditees' systems. In this case, we can record the cumulative total and balance of quantity of inventory or PPE in this table. This is a well-established practice in some countries, like France and China. Countries can choose to use GL_Trial_Balance or GL_Accounts_Period_Balance or both, depending on their customary practice, regulatory and managerial requirements.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. GL_ Account Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYYMM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Accounting period in which the financial statement occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Debit Quantity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The quantity information associated with debiting inventory and PPE.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Credit Quantity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The quantity information associated with crediting inventory and PPE.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Beginning Quantity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The beginning quantity of inventory or PPE account.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Ending Quantity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The ending quantity of inventory or PPE account.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. . Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the physical measurement scale for inventory and PPE. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Beginning_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The beginning balance direction for the account. Indicates whether beginning balance is debit or credit. For example, C=credit; D=debit.

data.DEN: Account Period Balance_ List. Ending_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The ending balance direction for the account. Indicates whether ending balance is debit or credit. For example, C=credit; D=debit.

data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: "The code and name for account segment, as well as the GL_Account_Number to which the account segment is related.The account segment provides additional information for particular GL_Accounts; for example, the accounts receivable contains the information regarding supplier, customer, employee, and project. Such information would be treated as an account segment below A/R, thus resulting in a lengthy account structure. In light of this, the account segment structure is defined as a set to record related information, efficiently avoiding the case that account names and numbers are extended to be too long and too complex. Account segment is more flexible to capture the complicated information.

data.ENTITY: Some of the most frequently used account segments, for example, project, employee and bank account, have been defined as fixed fields in tables, such as GL_Details. These segments are called fixed account segments in the document. Fixed account segments and other customized account segments are covered in this table."

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: "The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Account Segment Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the Account_Segment. Case 1 If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by Account_Segment_Name of the record. Case 2 If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account_Segment_X, named Account_Segment_5 in the tables, such as GL_Details. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Account Segment Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: "The name of the Account_Segment.

data.ENTITY: Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the name of a fixed account segment, such as Account_Segment_Employee.
Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 5, the field value should be the name of a customized account segment, like welfare expenditure."

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Corresponding File. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: "The table corresponding to account segment.

data.ENTITY: Case 1 If the value of Account_Segment_Number of the record is 0, the field contains the table name corresponding to the fixed account segment, such as BAS_Employee for Account_Segment_Employee.

Case 2 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and no other table besides BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment.

Case 3 If the value of Account_Segment_Number is larger than 0, and there is a table contains the basic information of the customized account segment, the field value should be the tablefs name, such as BAS_Customer."

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name.

data.DEN: Account Segment_ List. Customized Account Segment Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the customized account segment. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the BAS_ Customized_ACC_Segment table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains all of the journal entry details for each transaction; for example, the associated journal entry ID, the associated account number, and the debits or credits associated with the journal entry line. This table should be at the journal entry line level.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for each journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the journal entry; for example, including serial number, document type, and date.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Specified. Chart Of Account
data.DESCRIPTION: "The GL account number. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Accounting period in which the Effective_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1 -Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Effective. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or entered. This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date; for example, if the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20X1, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20X1.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Line Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of each line within a journal entry. This number is either generated by manual input or by the system.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Type Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of journal entry type. Shall match the JE_Type_Code in the BAS_Journal_Entry_Type table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Header Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Line Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Description of the individual line within the journal entry.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Source Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Code for source from which the journal entry originated; for example, sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, or spreadsheet. Shall match the Source_Code in the GL_Source table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Bill Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The number of the bill. A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrust the drawee at sight; a specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Bill Type Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The type of the bill; for example, bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. Shall match the Bill_Type_Code in the BAS_Bill_Type table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Bill Date. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The date of the bill.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Quantity. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line. When the GL_Account_Number is for inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective, if not, this field is NULL.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Measurement Unit Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of the physical measurement scale for inventory and PPE referred to as a unit of measurement (UOM). Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Unit Price. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The per unit price of the inventory or PPE. This field is associated with Quantity and Amount; for example, if the account is inventory or PPE, we can multiply Quantity by Unit_Price to get total line Amount.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Transaction Amount. Code
GL Details_ List. Settlement Method Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code value or indicator of the settlement method used for cash receipt from customers (i.e. sales) and cash payment to suppliers (i.e. purchase); for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether the amount is a credit or debit. 'C' = credit; 'D' = debit.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Reversal Indicator. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed. '1' = entry is a reversal, '2' = entry is being reversed, and empty ('') = none of the above or system generated indicators.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Reversal. Chart Of Account
data.DESCRIPTION: When the Reversal Indicator Code = 1, this identifies the Journal_ID of the entry being reversed.

data.DEN: GL Details_ List. Cancellation Sign. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted. For example, 0=entry is not cancelled, 1=entry is cancelled.

data.DESCRIPTION: Contains all adjustments recorded against the invoice and impacting the invoice balance during the period. For example, write-offs, credit memos, and other adjustments. For example, if an adjustment transaction impacted three invoices, there will be three records for that adjustment-one for each of the invoices impacted by the adjustment.

data.DEN: Account Payable Adjustment_ List. Type Name. Code

data.DEN: Account Payable Adjustment_ List. Document Number. Code

In the context of this process, cash means any type of payment received including checks and wire transfers and cash.

data.DESCRIPTION: Contains details regarding all open, unpaid, or unresolved payable transactions as of a specified date. Each row in this table represents the balance due to the supplier for one uniquely identifiable transaction. This file should be at the summary level (by invoice), not at the detailed level (by invoice line item). The sum total of the transaction amounts as of the specified date shall reconcile to the total AP amount in the general ledger (GL) as of the same date.

data.DEN: PPE Addition_ List. Tag Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.

data.DEN: PPE Department Allocation_ List. Department Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of department rosters; for example, the department name is IT department, the code is 0018. Shall match the Busieness_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.DEN: PPE Department Allocation_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the information correlating with PPE summarized depreciation in the period.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. ID
PPE Depreciation_ List. PPE ID. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match a PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Fiscal Year. Year_ Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Fiscal year in which the Created_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Accounting Period. Period_ Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Accounting period in which the Entered_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Depreciation Method ID. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The field is used to specify the depreciation method. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Depreciation_Method_ID in the PPE_Depreciation_Method table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Useful Life. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Total useful life of PPE in months.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Useful Life Remaining. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Remaining useful life of PPE in months as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Original_ Cost. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Original cost of PPE.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Residual_ Value. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Residual value of PPE as of the report date. Mostly it is calculated through an expected residual value ratio.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Depreciable_ Basis. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Depreciable basis of PPE, which shows the difference between original cost and residual value.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Depreciation Amount. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The amount of the depreciation recognized during the period.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Accumulated_ Depreciation. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The accumulated depreciation of PPE as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Carrying Amount. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The carrying amount of PPE as of the report date, which shows the difference between original cost and accumulated depreciation.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Specified. Depreciation_ Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which Income Statement amount is recognized for depreciation. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. Specified. Accumulated Depreciation_ Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recognized for accumulated depreciation. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation_ List. was. Approved_ Handling
PPE Depreciation_ List. was. Created_ Handling
PPE Depreciation_ List. was. Last Modified_ Handling
PPE Depreciation_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the information of depreciation methods used for PPE depreciation.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for different depreciation methods. Typically autogenerated by the system.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. Depreciation Method Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the depreciation method, for example, depreciation by straight-line method, double-declining-balance depreciation method.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. Depreciation Method Description. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Description associated with the method.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. Depreciation Formula. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The basic formula to calculate the depreciation.

data.DEN: PPE Depreciation Method_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.DESCRIPTION: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the details of each PPE item, for example, its code, specification, location, acquiring date, original cost, and quantity.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. PPE Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The internal code of PPE at the local level.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Tag Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Type Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique code of the PPE type. Shall match the Type_Code in the PPE_ Type table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. PPE Name. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the PPE.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. PPE Feature. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The feature is used to specify the PPE more clearly, for example, the brand, color, size and configuration.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Bar Code. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: Universal Product Code or other external code, for example, the product code from a primary supplier.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Purchase Order ID. Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the purchase order. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if the PPE is not generated from a purchase order. Otherwise shall match the Purchase_Order_ID in the PUR_Order_Details table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Inventory Product ID. Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the inventory item. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if the PPE is not generated from inventory. Otherwise shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Serial Number. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The number associated with an individual PPE that is used for tracking and managing (e.g. a company purchases 10 computers, with each computer be assigned a individual serial number).

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Lot Number. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The number associated with a PPE that is used for tracking and managing the lot.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Manufacturer. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: Manufacturer of the PPE.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Supplier Account ID. Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the supplier. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Location Description. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: Description of the location where the PPE is placed.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Condition Name. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of various usage status of PPE, for example, asset in-use, not-in-use and not-in-use for seasonal reasons.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Acquisition. Date
data.DESCRIPTION: Date that the PPE is acquired.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Posted. Date
data.DESCRIPTION: Date when PPE is posted into accounts.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Placed Into Service. Date
data.DESCRIPTION: Date that PPE is placed into use.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. On Hand_ Quantity. Quantity
data.DESCRIPTION: Quantity of PPE items on hand.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. . (Component of Quantity)
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the PPE. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Useful Life. Numeric
data.DESCRIPTION: Total useful life of PPE in months.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Useful Life Remaining. Numeric
data.DESCRIPTION: Remaining useful life of PPE in months as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Original_ Cost. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Original cost of PPE.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Residual_ Value. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Residual value of PPE as of the report date. This value is typically calculated by an expected residual value ratio.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Accumulated_ Depreciation. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The accumulated depreciation of PPE as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Impairment_ Provision. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The impairment provision of PPE as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Net Book_ Value. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Net book value of PPE as of the report date, which equals original cost minus accumulated depreciation and impairment provision.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Replacement_ Cost. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The replacement cost of PPE as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Fair_ Value. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Fair value of PPE as of the report date.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Functional_ Currency Code. (Component of Code)
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of functional or group currency related to the balance (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Defined. PPE_ Chart Of Accounts
data.DESCRIPTION: "The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recognized after the asset has been put into operation. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Impairment Provision_ Account Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recognized for impairment provision account. This number is either generated either by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: PPE Master_ List. Accumulated Depreciation_ Account Number. Code
data.DESCRIPTION: "The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recognized for accumulated depreciation. This number is either generated either by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the details related to PPE removal transactions.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the removal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. specified. PPE Master
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the PPE. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the PPE_ID in the PPE_Master table.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Fiscal Year. Year_ Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: Fiscal year in which the Removal_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Accounting Period. Period_ Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: Accounting period in which the Removal_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Tag Number. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The tag was commonly used when there was no ERP system to record PPE's state of the whole lifespan. Nowadays, some ERP systems still follow to use it in the business of PPE. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated; for example, when there is a PPE, a tag is created correspondingly. And each tag contains either one PPE or several PPEs. However, each PPE has its own PPE_ID as a unique identifier. If a tag only has one PPE, the PPE_ID is the same as the Tag_Number.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Type Name. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: Description of the removal type; for example, sale, retirement, disposal or damaged.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Date. Date
data.DESCRIPTION: The date that PPE is removed.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Reason. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The reason why there is a removal.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal_ Quantity. Quantity
data.DESCRIPTION: The reduced quantity of PPE.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Original_ Cost. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The reduced original cost during the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Accumulated_ Depreciation. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The reduced accumulated depreciation during the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Impairment_ Provision. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The reduced impairment provision during the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Residual_ Value. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The reduced residual value during the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Cash Proceeds Amount. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The amount of cash proceeds received from the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal Non Cash Proceeds Amount. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The amount of non-cash proceeds received from the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Removal_ Expense. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: The expense generated from the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Unrealized Gain Loss Amount. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Amount of unrealized gain/loss recorded on the Balance Sheet of removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Realized Gain Loss Amount. Amount
data.DESCRIPTION: Amount of realized gain/loss recorded on the Income Statement related to the removal transaction.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Functional_ Currency Code. (Component of Code)
data.DESCRIPTION: The code of functional or group currency related to the balance (ISO 4217). Shall match the Currency_Code in the BAS_Currency table.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Unrealized Gain Loss_ Account Number.
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which Balance Sheet amount is recorded for unrealized gain/loss. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: PPE Removal_ List. Realized Gain Loss_ Account Number.
data.DESCRIPTION: The GL account number on which Income Statement amount is recognized for realized gain/loss. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_of_Accounts table.

data.DEN: PPE Type_ List. Detail.
data.DESCRIPTION: Contains the details of each PPE type. (Property, Plant and Equipment)

data.DEN: PPE Type_ List. ID
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique code of letters and/or numbers used to represent or identify a PPE type. For instance, using 0201 to represent Manufacturing Equipment, using 0202 to represent Working Equipment.

data.DEN: PPE Type_ List. Type Name. Text
data.DESCRIPTION: The name of the type categorized by the PPE attributes, for example, land, buildings, machinery and equipment.

data.DEN: PPE Type_ List. Parent Type ID. Identifier
data.DESCRIPTION: The unique identifier for the parent PPE type. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Type_ID in the PPE_Type table.
